results.title: Seed germination
results.creator_credit: William M. Harlow and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 2. Plant life”

Explains how seeds serve plants in reproduction, distribution and as a device to survive unfavourable climatic periods. Shows how research into seed germination aids biologists in understanding growth, development and metabolism.

results.title: Seed dispersal: seed dispersal by burial
results.brief_description: An educational documentary that examines the sowing of seeds, fertilisation and their eventual sprouting. Once sprouting has taken place the seeds are released from the grown plant.

results.title: Seed dispersal. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Explains nature’s method of scattering seeds, germination, effect of moisture on seed dispersal and germination and the struggle for survival.

results.title: Seed dispersal
results.brief_description: Shows ways by which seeds of various plants are scattered in order to insure the propagation of the species. The methods illustrated include dispersal by the wind, transportation by animals, and forceful propulsion from the seed-case

results.title: See. No. 5
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Modern motors replace prancing ponies - ball game with motorcycles. 2. Motor maniacs - motorcycle obstacle racing. 3. Daring daughters of destiny - women in obstacle race. 4. Lions at home - lion attending her young in a cage. 5. Wildest teamwork - lion-drawn carriage. 6. A duck? No, a lion. 7. Polite bears. 8. A cinnamon bear milk shake. 9. Jousting comes back - modern knights in armour revive medieval sport and kill. 10. Jousting - a strange sight in the peaceful Seine. 11. Angry waters - seas in a hurricane; waves lashing against ships. 12. Real scenes of a real drama - boats thrown against shore.

results.title: See, touch, feel (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Artists-in-residence at high schools in Pennsylvania, Minnesota and Colorado demonstrate and discuss their methods of teaching young people. An innovative educational program which placed contemporary artists in the schools, provides an insight into the teaching-learning process as well as into the development of creativity. Featuring artists Mac Fisher, Don Coen and Charles Huntington.
results.description: Artists-in-residence at high schools in Pennsylvania, Minnesota and Colorado demonstrate and discuss their methods of teaching young people. results.title: See you at the pillar
results.brief_description: A sentimental journey around the capital city of Ireland showing the fine Georgian mansions, the people of Dublin at work, around the city, in the public gardens and at the zoo. Points out that the city is fast becoming another modern capital. Narrated by Anthony Quayle, Norman Rodway.

results.title: See how they run
results.brief_description: Shows, in a humorous way, the characteristic movements adapted to typical habits and environment. The animals seen in the film include snakes, seals, penguins, polar bears, tigers, lions, kangaroos, chimpanzees and gibbons.

results.title: See 'n tell: the lizard
results.brief_description: Shows the habits and life cycle of the common ground lizard as it feeds on insects and spiders, sheds its skin and mates in early summer. Also shows egg-laying by the female and the hatching of baby lizards. No narration.
results.description: Shows the habits and life cycle of the common ground lizard as it feeds on insects and spiders, sheds its skin and mates in early summer. Also shows egg-laying by the female and the hatching of baby lizards. No narration.
